label: 町年寄
本: Osaka: The Merchants' Capital of Early Modern Japan . Cornell University Press . 1999
著者: McClain, James L.  and Wakita Osamu
説明文: A neighborhood elder in Osaka; a functionary representing one or more residential quarters where merchants and artisans lived; reported to the city elders (sōdoshiyori) and was responsible for maintaining census registers, mediating neighborhood disputes, insuring that the residents of his quarter knew and obeyed all laws, etc.; in Edo, equivalent officials were known as nanushi and the term machidoshiyori referred to city elders
